did.unittitle: Charles L. Willits Book Trust records

bioghist.p: The Charles L. Willits Book Trust was established in 1895 by the will of Charles L. Willits to provide for the distribution of religious literature to Liberians and African-Americans in the southern United States. The main piece of literature was The African's Friend, a monthly publication produced and distributed by the Trustees of the Willits Trust.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence from schools and missions in Liberia and the American South related to the distribution and reception of The African's Friend; legal documents, correspondence, and minutes of the Trustees of the Willits Trust; bills and receipts related to shipping/postage of The African's Friend; canceled checks; and a copy of Charles Willits's will.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
